intro: Lychnis grandiflora var. tetrapetala, commonly known as the four-petaled campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pink to red flowers with four petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
